title: Oil Circuit

body.body: The oil circuit for this model engine has two main galleries, engine main oil and crankcase main oil gallery circuit.
Oil is collected from the sump and is drawn through a mesh strainer into the oil pump rotor.

The oil pump is fitted with a single pumping rotor which supplies pressurised oil to the lubrication circuit via the oil pressure relief valve (situated in the oil pump). The relief valve is set to open at 5.1 bar (75 lb/in
) and when open, returns high pressure oil direct to the sump.
If the oil pressure valve requires replacement, the oil pump and oil pressure valve assembly is to be replaced.
The oil flows directly from the oil pump rotor through the heat exchanger (mounted on the oil and water pump) then through a link pipe to the crankcases where it then flows through the oil filter.
The engine main oil gallery feeds engine oil to:

the crankshaft main bearings and, through a drilling in the crankshaft, the big end bearings and the alternator to aid cooling of the alternator components through a drilling in the bolt that secures the alternator rotor to the crankshaft.
the camshaft drive chain through a drilling in a bolt located in the upper crankcase above the crankshaft.
the oil pressure switch and the spray jets located in the upper crankcase near the base of the barrel. The spay jets lubricate the pistons and the connecting rod small ends.

the gearbox output shaft through a restriction in the crankcase and restriction washer at the output shaft. Oil is circulated along the output shaft to exit holes that feed directly to the bearings, gears and selectors.

the camshaft drive chain hydraulic tensioner and the camshafts through a check valve in the crankcase and a restriction in the cylinder head gasket. From the sprocket end of the camshafts oil is then fed through a drilling in the camshafts to the camshaft bearings, the finger followers and the valves.
The crankcase main oil gallery feeds engine oil to:
the transmission oil spray bar to lubricate the gears and selector forks.

the gearbox input shaft through a restriction in the crankcase and restriction washer at the input shaft. Oil is circulated along the input shaft to exit holes that feed directly to the bearings, gears and selectors.
the clutch from the input shaft.
the camshaft drive chain oil feed bolt.
Pressure relief valve, incorporated in oil pump
Heat exchanger, attached to the oil pump
Oil feed bolt for camshaft drive chain
